2. Pulmonary emboli, recent, left apical. left cardiac, left diaphragmatic, right

3. Infarcts. recent, right apical, left epical, left cardiac, left diaphragmatic,
right cardiac and right intermediate lobes.
4. Edema and congestion of all lobes of the lung
5. Basal cell hyperplasia, slight
5. Acute bronchitis, left apical, left cardiac, left diaphragmatic, right cardiac

7.
Bronchopneumonia, recent, left apical, left cardiac, left diaphragmatic, right
apical, right cardiac and right intermediate lobes.
8. Focal calcification, right diaphragmatic lob
9. Passive congestion of the liver, adrenals, spleen and kidney, advanced
COMMENT
The dog was on the PMO study in Enviro Control and was a high nicotine smoker,
had smoked 399 cigarettes in a period of 34 days. The findings in the case were those
of thrombi in both auricular appendages of the heart with multiple emboli in six of
the seven lobes. As a result of these emboll, recent infarcts developed within the lung.
As is common in the presence of infarction, bronchopneumonia is a complication.
It has been our experience that dogs who smoke a high nicotine cigarette devejop
pulmonary Infarction. The origin of the emboli is in the thrombi within the auriculag
appendage. Thrombosis in the heart occurs infrequently in low nicotine cigarette
smoking dogs. It is interesting that this dog as well as Dog 6025 and other 200
smokers show similar changes. The presence of the pneumonia is a complication of
the pulmonary infarction.

Experimental Laboratory of Cardiopulmonary and Genital Pathology, Department of
Pathology, University of Leuven, 12, Minderbroodersstraat, 5 - 3000 LEUVEN BELGH
3. Short Tile of Projec
The lymphatics of the lung. Their role in fluid transport and clearance of sir-
borne particulate matter in normal and experimental conditions and in various
lung diseases.
Proposed Starting Date:
January 1, 1973.
5. Anticipated Duretion of the Specific Study:
Three (3) years.
6. Brief Descripton of Objectives or Specific Aims:
Despite our experience in the proposed field of investigation, numerous aspects of the
structure and function of the pulecnary lymphatics are still either largely unknown or a
catter of considerable controversy in the literature. Each technique of study having its
shortcomings, these can only be solved accurately by a further and multidisciplinary in-
vestigation of the pulmonary lymphatics which will include various techniques, i.e.
anatomical injection studies, stereomicroscopical studies, serial reconstructions,
radiography and microradiography, histological techniques, corphometrical techniques,
histochesical techniques, transzission electron microscopy, freeze-etching electron
zicroscopy and scanning electron aicroscopy.
During the three years of this research proposal we intend to study the pulmonary lympha-
tics with the techniques proposed along three major lines of investigation - (1)
normal morphology of the pulmonary lymphatics, (2) an experimental study of the various
corphological factors involved in the clearance and lymphatic drainage of the long paren-
chyba, (3) and morphological studies of the lung lymphatics in various pathological con
dicions especially in such cases where the formation of lung edema is observed (e.g.
natal lungs hyaline ccbrane disease adult lungs pulmonary edema, especially when
associated with chronic respiratory insufficiency as in chronic bronchitis or emphysema,
shock tongs (cardiogenic and neurogenic), uremia, drouming...). Though the lines of investi-
gation are distinct, che study object (ie. the lymphatics) is identical and the results
interrelated.
neo-
These studies will necessarily end in important and original contributions which will
have many basic and applied results in the structure and function of the normal and
diseased lung. It is obvious that these studies are of immediate and relevant importance
in biological tobacco research.
5
7. Give a Brint Statement of your Working Hypothesis:
A combined and multidisciplinary morphological investi-
gation by a team of investigators working closely to-
gether since several years, will allow to avoid the
shortcomings of each individual technique of investi-
gation in lymphatic resparch. Studies of pulmonary fload transport and of airborne particu
late matter in normal diseased lungs and in experimental conditions urgently request a pre-
cise and up-to-date knowledge of the pulmonary lymphatics, which is still lacking.

A. INITIATOR OF TEST: J. SHARKEY
B. DATE SUBMITTED: 7/12/91
C. PURPOSE OF TEST: TO COLLECT DATA ON PRESS SYSTEM EFFICIENCY AFTER
MAXIMIZING THE PRESS SYSTEM THRUPUT RATE.
(PRESS EVALUATION TEAM)
D. TEST PROCEDURE AND SAMPLE COLLECTION/AMALYSIS:
TH
1. ON 7/15/91, A PRELIMINARY TEST WILL BE CONDUCTED TO DETERMINE
THE APPROPRIATE SET POINTS FOR KEY PRESS SYSTEM STD3 WHEN
OPERATING THE PRESSES AT A MAXIMUM CUSTAINABLE THRUPUT RATE.
THIS TEST WILL BE CONDUCTED CHAIN SANE 1 A&B PRISSS LINES
TEAM ANTICIPATES THIS TEST TO LAST APPROXIMATELY 2-4 HOURS
ADDITIONAL SAMPLING WILL BE REQUIRED DURING THIS SET-UP `PERIOD.
NOTE: DURING THIS AND FUTURE PRESS SYSTEM TESTING, ALL PROCESS
STAGE STANDARDS WILL BE TEMPORARILY SUSPENDED.
NO
2. ON 7/25 AT APPROXIMATELY 0700 HOURS, THE LINE 1 A&B PRESS LINE
THRUPUT RATES WILL BE SET AT THE RATE IDENTIFIED ON 7/15/91.
THE INCREASED THRUPUT RATE SHOULD BE MAINTAINED FOR A MINIMUM
OF 48 HOURS (TEST SHOULD END AT 0700 KOURS ON 7/17/91.
3. AFTER THE SYSTEM HAS STABILIZED, SAMPLING SHOULD BEGIN.
SAMPLES SHOULD BE COLLECTED ONCE EVERY FOUR HOURS UNTIL
A TOTAL OF 10 SAMPLE SETS HAVE BEEN COLLECTED (DEVIATION
FROM THE FOUR HOUR FREQUENCY SHOULD BE AVOIDED). SAMPLES
WILL BE COLLECTED FROM THE LINE 1 RUN PULPER AND FROM
LINE I-3B PRESS.
4. SAMPLES SHOULD BE SEALED IN A 1 LITER CONTAINER AND REFRIG-
GERATED UNTIL SAMPLE ANALYSIS CAN BE PERFORMED.

As per our meeting on Wednesday, April 13th with Carl Cohen and Mark Walchak, and our
subsequent telephone conversations with Mark on April 14th, we have been requested to continue
with designs for the Brand X project as follows:
- As a result of preliminary research testing of selected designs for this project, we are to prepare
the following additional design revisions.
Basically the consumers did not like the white background shown on the test designs as they were
viewed as being generic, especially in combination with a red, white and blue color scheme.
- The designs showing the kraft background was viewed es being more like a cigar product, too
strong, heavy looking.
⚫ The use of a script for the logo was also viewed as being somewhat confusing, that "Phil" (Mal,
Jake, or Dave) wouldn't necessarily witte or sign their names this way, etc., that a simple typeface or
printed name would be more appropriate.
Also the use of gold on the design, especially if a lot of gold is used was not in keeping with Phil's.
The all red background pack design wasn't appropriate for Phil's, it was too much, too heavy, etc.
Based upon the above information, Car would like for us to take our original Phil's design P3-12550
(P4-12550) and prepare additional face panel Ins color prints with the following revisions.
• Take the Phil's symbol and lighten the overall color scheme to make it less reminiscent of a cigar
product.
Pemaps the design itself can be modified so that it is less of a cigar band by taking the Phil's
ribbon and changing it to more of a diagonal ribbon. Try this in combination with a lighter color
scheme.

You have recently received a fax copy of the preliminary results of American

Abstract A method is described using specialized techniques for the calfection, sample preparation, and analysis of mainstrear)
tobacco smoke condensate (TSC) for the determination or grace level iron, aluminum, cejnaum, chromium, nickel, ausente, and lead.
Mainstream cigarette smoke was collected with a 5 port linear smoking machine utilizing electrostatic precipitation (EP).
Modifications were made to micet stringent, clean collection requirements for nace elements that include: specially designed rungszen
electrodes and replacement of metal parts in the cigarette smoking machine with polypropylene pans. All collections were performed
in a vertical laminar flow HEPA-filtered air clean beach. Samples were collected using FTC specifications: 35 n puff volume, 60%
puli frequency, 2° puff duration. Sample preparation procedures were performed in a clean environment. A portion of the smoke
condensate was quantitatively removed from die quartz EP sube, musferred to a 100 mL, volumetric flask, and prepared using
methanol, nitric acid, and ultra-pure water. The extract solutions were analyzed by ICP-MS or GFAAS. The results of TR4F FSC
analyses for these trace level elements are compared with literature values of sumiler cigarette types.

Abstract: Wetting experiments were carried out with filler metals such as pure silver, copper, gold, potladium and nickel on
the surface of hot pressed MoSig specimens under vacuum. Wetting was observed for each of these combinations.
Metallographie examination revealed that chemical reaction also occurred for each combination. Both silver and gold
reacted similarly with the Moši, For these two cases, metal droplets alloyed with silicon during the experiments, and
this was reflected in their microstructures. The source of silicon in these two cases was decomposition of MoSig beneath
the liquid droplets. Molten nickel reacted with MoSi2, diffusing into the compound and forming nickel silvides.
Palladium also dissolved the MoSig, but not as extensively as nickel. In the case of Pd/MoSig system, a number of
palladium silicide reaction layers were formed.

As a reminder, these materials should be give to smokers 21
years of age and older only.
As I'm sure you are aware, cigarettes are a target of
anti-litter campaigns. Smokers who don't take the time to
properly dispose of their cigarette litter only compound the
problem. Cigarette litter -- filters, packaging and carton
materials -- should be disposed of in designated waste
containers and not haphazardly discarded.
The pocket ashtray offers one solution to the litter problem.
First introduced in Japan, the pocket ashtray has promoted
courteous smoking in that country for almost 30 years.
The reusable ashtray is made of plastic and the inside contains
a fire-resistant material to prevent burning. While the
package is designed to extinguish the cigarette, we recommend
putting the cigarette out first, and then placing the butt in
the pouch.

Dear Ms. Crumpton:
Thank you for your interest in our youth non-smoking materials.
The table cards and booklets you ordered are enclosed. The
posters are being sent separately.
The posters can be placed in classrooms, on school bulletin
boards, and in other locations where the students will see them.
The table cards can be placed on teachers' and counselors'
desks, on cafeteria tables, etc.
The two booklets are designed to be used by parents and other
adults when talking to kids about peer pressure and peer
influence. They are for use by counselors and interested
teachers. You might also want to give a few copies to your
parent group leader. We can provide additional copies to the
parent group if there is interest.
The quantity of booklets you requested, however, has been
reduced, as they were developed for use by adults rather than
for distribution to students.
Thank you again for your interest. We hope these materials will
be helpful in your efforts to persuade young people not to smoke.
Sincerely,

I have enjoyed my first year as a new member of the State Assembly and I am excited to be
part of our Republican leadership team.
In the past, legislators have been able to contact lobbyists directly to seek funds for their
campaign committees. However, the passage of Proposition 208 in 1996 banned such contact with
lobbyists and created much confusion among legislators, PAC directors and others involved with
the financing of political campaigns.
I believe the enclosed card will help to answer many of the most commonly asked questions,
in language that can be understood by everyone. The answers come directly from the Fair Political
Practices Commission (FPPC) and represent the most up-to-date information available.
The FPPC has informed me that I am able to raise funds from PACs and corporations
during the current blackout period. The maximum you can give is $500 which represents $250 for
my 1996 Primary Election debt and $250 for my 1996 General Election debt. I would greatly
appreciate a contribution from you at this time to help me clear up these debts.
I will continue to keep you informed on the latest rulings and decisions that impact
California politics. Of course, feel free to call me anytime should you have any questions or
concerns about other issues facing our state.
P.S.
Sincerely,
Yelange
George Runner
Member of the Assembly

CDNA expression array analysis of mRNA levels in cultured normal human
bronchial epithelial, lung adenocarcinoma, and small cell lung carcinoma cells.
Hellmann, G.M., Qian, X., Fields, W.R., Bombick, D.W. and Doolittle. D.J
Biological Research, RJR Research & Development, RJ Reynolds, Winston-Salem,
NC 27102.
The generation of varying complex phenotypes displayed by human lung tumors is a
poorly understood phenomenon brought about by changes in the expression spectrum
of a wide range of genes. The complete phenotype may involve changes in the
expression of different gene classes including oncogenesftumor suppressor genes.
cell-cell communication-related genes, cytokines, apoptosis, and cell cycling genes.
Hence, the simultaneous monitoring of differential and quantitative changes in these
genes can provide mechanistic information to increase our understanding of human
pulmonary carcinogenesis models. To this end, we have employed a commercially
available human cDNA microarray to systematically screen for alterations in the
expression of over 500 human genes. Total mRNA was obtained from cultured cells
of normal human brocchial epithelia as well as several lung carcinoraa lines. The
expression level of each gene was compared and normalized with three housekeeping
genes (ubiquitin, B-actin, and ribosomal protein 89). Among the carcinoma lines, the
class exhibiting the greatest number of gene expression increases from normal
bronchial epithelia was that containing oncogenes tumor suppressor genes, while the
class exhibiting the greatest number of decreases was one containing cell-cell
communication-related genes. In this preliminary study, e cDNA array expression
methodology has shown promise as a useful tool in simultaneous monitoring of
complex gene expression changes during stages of pulmonary carcinogenesis.

COMPETITIVE PRODUCT INTRODUCTION
PROGRESS REPORT
TO: K. A. SPARROW
FROM: D. J Landro
DATE:
9/10/96
REPORTING PERIODS:
AUG
MANUFACTURER: R. J. Reynolds
BRAND: Camel Menthol
TYPE OF PACKINGS: Full Flavor Box and Light Box
SEPT
OCT
NOV
(Forward by the 10th of the following month.)
TEST MARKET GEOGRAPHY: The area involved is the R.J. Reynolds Chicago Region and Buffalo Region,
In the Chicagoland area, the product is being worked by the Sales Reps, with POS, of all types, including metal
signs, counter mats, danglers, posters, decals, and mobile hanging pleces. The billboard support is very heavy
along expressways and in the towns. In Wisconsin, the product is available from approximately Beloit to Madison
to Fond du Lac to Kenosha. The area on the attached map includes the Milwaukee Metro area. In this area, there
is little or no POS, no billboards, and currently no promotional support, other than some 30¢ coupons or stickers
on permanent displays to tie in with Camel support.
PRICE POINT: FULL $ 11.89 (indicates distribution cost per carton)
SALES FORCE INVOLVEMENT: Illinois - Product was pre-booked into accounts for rapid distribution. POS
is placed on perms and in many instances only "Menthol" appears on the display if only a 1-tray unit for Camels.
There are panels for the lighted headers on perms, Sales Reps have been pre-booking orders for 81G1F
product, which has appeared at retail and, in most cases, has sold through very fast. Reps are also placing
facsimile displays that are a heavy-duty cardboard unit, which has 4 columns, 2 cartons of each packing.
Wisconsin Product was pre-sold and shipped; however, it does not appear that the sales force is actively
promoting. Menthol is on the perm displays, 1–2 rows of each, and no promotional support. Occasionally,
a retailer has been told that the Sales Rep will coupon It the next time around.
DISTRIBUTORS - ACCEPTANCE/INTRO TERMS/INTRO DEALS:
All direct accounts have accepted the product.
Camel Menthol is only in EM's. List price and terms are the same as Camel
Intro allowance has been reported as $15 per 6M case.
DISTRIBUTOR INVOLVEMENT: Dearborn Grocery Wholesalers was asked to solicit 4 carton displays by their
Sales Rep in their account. The Dearborn Sales Reps offer the retailer $5 for the display, and the Sales Rep
also receives $4 for each display shipped. This offer was supposed to be extended to any Dearborn Reps
working Illinois, Indiana (northern), Michigan (southwestern area), and Ohio.
All major Illinois jobbers have been shipping out pre-booked B1G1F product and live product for pre-booked
orders. There has been nothing, to date, reported about B1G1F deals in Wisconsin jobbers. McLane, from southem”
Illinois, has reported shipping B1G1F deals into the Open Pantry chain in Wisconsin (15 stores). This is one of the
few accounts McLane has in Wisconsin.
Kwik Trip (253 stores) accepted the product for their lowa stores only and has shipped a 40-pack temp display
to those stores in lowa only with 300 coupons.
Banner Wholesale (Chicago) has been selling 30-pack (40-deal) B1G1F displays off their sales floor to
Cash & Carry customers.
